result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario D Carlisle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
56 days jail credit if probation is revoked
may transfer probation to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.
Drug buy money to be collected during probation and forwarded back to Ozaukee County.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.

Defendant to submit to random testing.
Submit DNA.

timeConds.notes:
NO HUBER
may transfer to Milwaukee County IF ACCEPTED by sheriff of BOTH counties

Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon she/he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she/he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored.
